message: it seems there are a lot of defensive commenters lately, accusing article writers of linkbait
I'd rather have interesting article titles. So if you get accused of linkbait, most of the time, carry on!

Putting a title of EMC on makes it sound more interesting, but it's misleading. One would think "oh, perhaps his SAN exploded due to some reason". A more accurate title of "I used Mozy's free backup service and got screwed" would have been fine.

In your second example, "Why I no longer trust EMC", the title is "linkbait". The author describes a poor experience with Mozy (which, from the homepage, doesn't associate at all with EMC) and then claims he no longer trusts EMC.
